docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Sandra Siskind, a daughter of Linda and Howard Siskind of Lawrence, N.Y., was married last evening to Jeremy Edward Holgersen, the son of Judy Holgersen of Bronxville, N.Y., and Dr. Leif Holgersen of West Harrison, N.Y. Cantor Robert Ableson officiated at the Ritz-Carlton Battery Park in New York. Ms. Siskind, 33, will keep her name. She is a publicist at Arista Records in New York. She graduated summa cum laude from New York University. Her father, who retired as a co-owner of Bernette Knitwear, a maker of men's sweaters in New York, is a trustee of the village of Lawrence and the vice president of the fund-raising board of St. John's Episcopal Hospital in Far Rockaway, Queens. Her mother is a special education teacher at Lawrence Middle School.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Francesca Kann, the daughter of Peter R. Kann of Princeton, N.J., and the late Francesca Dorothea Kann, was married yesterday to Clayton Gray Lane, a son of Carlana Lane and Dr. Dewey Hobson Lane of Pascagoula, Miss. The Rev. Leanne Simmons, an American Baptist minister, performed a Methodist ceremony at the Miller Chapel at the Princeton Theological Seminary in Princeton, N.J. Mr. and Mrs. Lane graduated from Wake Forest University.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham, in her 1969 Wellesley College commencement address, eloquently summed up the hopes of her generation: ''We're searching for more immediate, ecstatic and penetrating modes of living. . . . Every protest, every dissent, is unabashedly an attempt to forge an identity in this particular age.'' That idealistic, forthright Hillary is gone -- one of the saddest and most destructive consequences of the Monica Lewinsky scandal. In her place is a new Hillary, loyal wife. And, according to a recent New York Times/CBS News poll, 73 percent of Americans now approve of her. Her approval rating is at a record high, even as her actual achievements are at a record low.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by playwright Wendy Wasserstein says one of saddest and most destructive consequences on Monica Lewinsky sex scandal is that it has reduced First Lady Hillary Rodham Clinton to status of loyal wife; says impressive personal qualities of idealism, strength and poise under pressure are being used to maintain domestic tranquility, and that maintaining dignity of her marriage is now seen as her greatest professional triumph (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Day Bidwell, a daughter of Gail S. Bidwell of Greenwich, Conn., and J. Truman Bidwell Jr. of New York, was married yesterday to Rupert Mackay, a son of Stuart M. Mackay of Durban, South Africa, and Anne Mackay of Bourne End, Buckinghamshire, England. The Rev. Hugh Palmer performed the Church of England ceremony at Southwark Cathedral in London. Mrs. Mackay teaches Bible studies at St. Helen's Church in London. She graduated from Yale University and received a master's degree in English from King's College in London. Her father is a partner in the law firm of White & Case in New York. Her paternal grandfather, the late J. Truman Bidwell, was a chairman of the New York Stock Exchange.
